00280 //  CTCLInterpreter.cpp
00281 // Encapsulates a TCL Command interpreter.
00282 // in an object oriented way.  Note that many
00283 // of the TCL functions have been split off
00284 // into the TCLInterpreterObjects.  These are
00285 // classes which implement functionally distinct
00286 // segments of TCL functionality.
00287 //
00288 //  This implementation is based on the documentation
00289 // in parts III and IV of _Tcl_and_the_Tk_Toolkit_
00290 //  by J. K. Ousterhout, Addison Wesley 1994 
00291 // ISBN 0-201-63337-x
00292 //
00293 //
00294 //   Author:
00295 //      Ron Fox
00296 //      NSCL
00297 //      Michigan State University
00298 //      East Lansing, MI 48824-1321
00299 //      mailto:fox@nscl.msu.edu
00300 //
00302 
00303 //
00304 // Header Files:
00305 //
00306 
00307 #include "TCLInterpreter.h"                               
00308 #include "TCLException.h"
00309 
00310 
00311 // Functions for class CTCLInterpreter
00312 
00314 //
00315 //  Function:   
00316 //    std::string Eval ( const char* pScript )
00317 //  Operation Type:
00318 //     Script evaluation.
00319 //
00320 std::string 
00321 CTCLInterpreter::Eval(const char* pScript) 
00322 {
00323 // Evaluates a TCL script contained in any of several types
00324 // of strings. If the evaluation was successful, the result
00325 // string is returned.  If not, then a CTCLException is
00326 // thrown.
00327 //
00328 // Formal Parameters:
00329 //      The following represent a set of
00330 //      alternative representations of the
00331 //      script variable type:
00332 //          const char*            pScript
00333 //          const CTCLString& rScript
00334 //          const std::string&    rScript
00335 //               String containing the script.
00336 // Returns:
00337 //    Result of the evaluation.
00338 
00339   int Status = Tcl_Eval(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pScript);
00340   
00341   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00342     throw CTCLException(*this,
00343                         Status,
00344                         "CTCLInterpreter::Eval - Evaluating expression");
00345   }
00346   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00347 }
00349 //
00350 //  Function:   
00351 //    std::string EvalFile ( const char* pFilename )
00352 //  Operation Type:
00353 //     Script Evaluation
00354 //
00355 std::string 
00356 CTCLInterpreter::EvalFile(const char* pFilename) 
00357 {
00358 // Evaluates the script contained in the file.
00359 //  If successful, returns the string result of
00360 //  the evaluation. If failed, throws a CTCLException
00361 // 
00362 // Formal Parameters:
00363 //      Below are alternative representations of
00364 //      the filename:
00365 //
00366 //       const char*            pFilename
00367 //       const CTCLString& rFilename
00368 //       const std::string&    rFilename:
00369 //            Name of the file contaning
00370 //            a script to evaluate.
00371 //  Returns:
00372 //     Result string of the script..
00373 //     the result string has the error on failure.
00374 
00375   int Status = Tcl_EvalFile(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pFilename);
00376   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00377     throw CTCLException(*this,
00378                         Status,
00379                         "CTCLInterpreter::EvalFile - Evaluating file script");;
00380   }
00381   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00382 }
00384 //
00385 //  Function:   
00386 //    std::string GlobalEval ( const char* pScript )
00387 //  Operation Type:
00388 //     script evaluator
00389 //
00390 std::string 
00391 CTCLInterpreter::GlobalEval(const char* pScript) 
00392 {
00393 // Evaluates a script at the global level.
00394 // See Eval for parameters etc.
00395 
00396   int Status = Tcl_GlobalEval(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pScript);
00397   
00398   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00399     CTCLException except(*this,
00400                         Status,
00401                         "CTCLInterpreter::Eval - Evaluating expression");
00402     throw except;
00403   }
00404   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00405 
00406 }
00408 //
00409 //  Function:   
00410 //    std::string RecordAndEval ( const char* pScript )
00411 //  Operation Type:
00412 //     script evaluation
00413 //
00414 std::string 
00415 CTCLInterpreter::RecordAndEval(const char* pScript, Bool_t fEvaluate) 
00416 {
00417 // Records and optionally evaluates
00418 //  the script parameter in the TCL History list.
00419 //  
00420 // Formal Parameters:
00421 //        <The usual alternatives for strings which
00422 //         contain the script>
00423 //
00424 //     Bool_t fEvaluate:
00425 //           kfTRUE to evaluate the script prior to insertion.
00426 //  Returns:
00427 //      The results of the script on success or
00428 //       throws an exception on error.
00429 
00430   int Status = Tcl_RecordAndEval(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pScript, fEvaluate);
00431   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00432     CTCLException except(*this,
00433                         Status,
00434                         "CTCLInterpreter::RecordAndEval - Evaluating script");
00435     throw except;
00436   }
00437 
00438   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00439 
00440 }
00442 //
00443 //  Function:   
00444 //    std::string ExprString ( const char* pExpression )
00445 //  Operation Type:
00446 //     Expression evaluation
00447 //
00448 std::string 
00449 CTCLInterpreter::ExprString(const char* pExpression) 
00450 {
00451 // Evaluates an expression as a string.  The
00452 // result of the evaluation is stored in the
00453 // interpreter result string.
00454 //
00455 // Formal Parameters:
00456 //     <The usual choices for strings>
00457 // Returns:
00458 //    The string.  On failure to evaluate,  a
00459 //    CTCLException is thrown.
00460 
00461   int Status = Tcl_ExprString(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pExpression);
00462   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00463     CTCLException e(*this,
00464                     Status,
00465           "CTCLInterpreter::ExprString - Evaluating string expression");
00466     throw e;
00467   }
00468   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00469 
00470 }
00472 //
00473 //  Function:   
00474 //    Long_t ExprLong ( const char* pExpression )
00475 //  Operation Type:
00476 //     Expression Evaluation
00477 //
00478 Long_t 
00479 CTCLInterpreter::ExprLong(const char* pExpression) 
00480 {
00481 // Evaluates the specified string as an expression
00482 // returning a longword value. If unable to evaulate
00483 // to a long, then a CTCLException is thrown indicating
00484 // why the failure occured, and the result string
00485 // is set to an error message.
00486 //
00487 // Formal Parameters:
00488 //    A string containing the expression
00489 //   represented in any of the usual ways.
00490 //
00491 // Returns:
00492 //   The longword value evaluated.
00493   Long_t l;
00494   int    Status =  Tcl_ExprLong(m_pInterpreter, 
00495                                 (char*)pExpression,
00496                                 &l);
00497   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00498     CTCLException e(*this,
00499                     Status,
00500                     "CTCLInterpreter::ExprLong - Evaluating long expression");
00501     throw e;
00502   }
00503   return l;
00504 
00505 
00506 }
00508 //
00509 //  Function:   
00510 //    DFloat_t ExprDouble ( const char* pExpression )
00511 //  Operation Type:
00512 //     Expression evaluator
00513 //
00514 DFloat_t 
00515 CTCLInterpreter::ExprDouble(const char* pExpression)
00516 {
00517 // Evaluates a string as an expression
00518 // returning a floating point value.
00519 // If the evaluation fails, then an exception
00520 // is returned.   If the evaulation succeeds,
00521 // the value is returned.
00522 //
00523 // Formal Parameters:
00524 //    The usual assortment of string types
00525 //     representing the expression.
00526 //
00527 // Returns:
00528 //   The floating point value of the expression
00529 //
00530   DFloat_t f;
00531   Int_t    Status = Tcl_ExprDouble(m_pInterpreter, 
00532                                    (char*)pExpression,
00533                                    &f);
00534   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00535     CTCLException e(*this,
00536                     Status,
00537                     "CTCLInterpreter::ExprDouble - Evaluating dbl expression");
00538     throw e;
00539   }
00540   return f;
00541 
00542 }
00544 //
00545 //  Function:   
00546 //    Bool_t ExprBoolean ( const char*  pExpression )
00547 //  Operation Type:
00548 //     Expression Evaluation
00549 //
00550 Bool_t 
00551 CTCLInterpreter::ExprBoolean(const char*  pExpression) 
00552 {
00553 // Evaluates a character string as a
00554 // boolean value.  The value of the
00555 // bool is returned.  If the evaluation
00556 // fails, a CTCLException is thrown.
00557 //
00558 // Formal Parameters:
00559 //     The expression string expressed
00560 //      in any of the assorted available string
00561 //      types.
00562 // Returns:
00563 //    The value of the expression.
00564 
00565   Int_t flag;
00566   int   Status = Tcl_GetBoolean(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pExpression, &flag);
00567   if(Status != TCL_OK) {
00568     CTCLException e(*this,
00569                     Status,
00570                     "CTCLInterpreter::ExprBoolean - Evaluating boolean expr.");
00571     throw e;
00572   }
00573   return (flag ? kfTRUE : kfFALSE);
00574 }
00576 //
00577 //  Function:   
00578 //    std:string TildeSubst ( const char* pFilename )
00579 //  Operation Type:
00580 //     parse
00581 //
00582 std::string 
00583 CTCLInterpreter::TildeSubst(const char* pFilename) const 
00584 {
00585 // Provides support for filenames which begin with ~ 
00586 // ~user/ by substituting this with the appropriate
00587 //  path prefix.  If an error occurs during the subsititution
00588 //  (e.g. user doesn't exist?) a CTCLException is thrown
00589 //
00590 // Formal Parameters:
00591 //    The filename in any of the three acceptable
00592 //     string types.
00593 // Returns:
00594 //     std::string - filename with the name appropriately
00595 //     substituted.
00596 
00597   Tcl_DString result;
00598   char*       pResult = Tcl_TildeSubst(m_pInterpreter,
00599                                        (char*)pFilename,
00600                                        &result);
00601   std::string stdResult(pResult);
00602   Tcl_DStringFree(&result);
00603   return stdResult;
00604 }
00606 //
00607 //  Function:   
00608 //    std::string PosixError (  )
00609 //  Operation Type:
00610 //     POSIX interface
00611 //
00612 std::string 
00613 CTCLInterpreter::PosixError() const 
00614 {
00615 // Sets the interpreter error code with a string 
00616 // that makes sense given the current value of
00617 // errno, and returns a string identifying the
00618 // error (strerror()??).
00619 
00620   return std::string(Tcl_PosixError(m_pInterpreter));
00621 
00622 }
00624 //
00625 //  Function:   
00626 //    std::string ErrnoId (  )
00627 //  Operation Type:
00628 //     POSIX interface
00629 //
00630 std::string 
00631 CTCLInterpreter::ErrnoId()  
00632 {
00633 // Returns a symbolic string identifying the
00634 // error currently stored in errno e.g. EBADF
00635 
00636   return std::string(Tcl_ErrnoId());
00637 
00638 }
00640 //
00641 //  Function:   
00642 //    std::string SignalId ( UInt_t nSignal )
00643 //  Operation Type:
00644 //     POSIX interface
00645 //
00646 std::string 
00647 CTCLInterpreter::SignalId(UInt_t nSignal) 
00648 {
00649 // Returns a string identifying a signal
00650 // e.g. SIGINT
00651 //
00652 // Formal parameters:
00653 //   UInt_t nSignal:
00654 //      The signal to lookup.
00655 
00656   return std::string(Tcl_SignalId((Int_t)nSignal));
00657 
00658 }
00660 //
00661 //  Function:   
00662 //    std::string SignalMsg ( UInt_t nSignal )
00663 //  Operation Type:
00664 //     POSIX interface.
00665 //
00666 std::string 
00667 CTCLInterpreter::SignalMsg(UInt_t nSignal) 
00668 {
00669 // Returns a human readable message which
00670 // identifies the signal
00671 //
00672 // Formal Parameters:
00673 //    UInt_t nSignal:
00674 //      Signal to identify
00675 
00676   return std::string(Tcl_SignalMsg(nSignal));
00677 
00678 }
00680 //
00681 //  Function:   
00682 //    void DetachProcess ( const std::vector>UInt_t>& rPids )
00683 //  Operation Type:
00684 //     POSIX interface
00685 //
00686 void 
00687 CTCLInterpreter::DetachProcess(const std::vector<UInt_t>& rPids) const 
00688 {
00689 // Passes responsibility for a set of process ids to
00690 // TCL's zombie process reaper functions  On error
00691 // will throw the appropriate CTCLException..
00692 //
00693 // Formal Parameters:
00694 //        one of the following:
00695 //          const std::vector<UInt_t>& rPids:
00696 //          const UInt_t nPids, const UInt_t* pPids:
00697 //              where:
00698 //                      nPids is the number of Process id's
00699 //                      pointed to by pPids.
00700 //                      pPids points to an array of process ids,
00701 //                      and rPids refers to a vector of process ids.
00702 //   
00703 
00704   UInt_t nPids = rPids.size();
00705   Int_t  *pPids= new Int_t[nPids];
00706   for(int i = 0; i < nPids; i++) {
00707     pPids[i] = rPids[i];
00708   }
00709   Tcl_DetachPids(nPids, (Tcl_Pid*)pPids);
00710   delete []pPids;
00711 
00712 }
00714 //
00715 //  Function:   
00716 //    void AddCommand ( const char* pCommandName, 
00717 //                      Tcl_CmdProc* pCommandProcessor, ClientData pData, 
00718 //                      Tcl_CmdDeleteProc* pDeleteProcessor=kpNULL )
00719 //  Operation Type:
00720 //     Legacy bridge
00721 //
00722 void 
00723 CTCLInterpreter::AddCommand(const char* pCommandName, 
00724                             Tcl_CmdProc* pCommandProcessor, 
00725                             ClientData pData, 
00726                             Tcl_CmdDeleteProc* pDeleteProcessor) const 
00727 {
00728 // Adds a non-object oriented command
00729 // to the interpreter.  Object oriented commands
00730 // are represented by CTCLProcessor objects which
00731 // contain members which can register them on one or
00732 // more interpreters.   This function is intended to
00733 // support legacy C language command interpreters
00734 // which might be used in the TCL++ environment.
00735 //
00736 // Formal Paramters:
00737 //     const char*            pCommandName
00738 //     const CTCLString& rCommandName
00739 //     const std::string&    rCommandName:
00740 //            Name of the command to register.
00741 //     Tcl_CmdProc* pCmdProcessor:
00742 //            Pointer to command processing function
00743 //     ClientData       pClientData:
00744 //            Data passed without interpretation to the cmd processor.
00745 //      Tcl_CmdDeleteProcI pDeleteProcessor = kpNULL:
00746 //            Pointer to function called if command is deleted from an interpreter.
00747 //
00748 //             
00749 // Exceptions:  
00750 
00751   Tcl_CreateCommand(m_pInterpreter,
00752                     (char*)pCommandName,
00753                      pCommandProcessor,
00754                     pData,
00755                     pDeleteProcessor);
00756   
00757 }
00759 //
00760 //  Function:   
00761 //    void UnregisterCommand (  )
00762 //  Operation Type:
00763 //     Legacy bridge
00764 //
00765 void 
00766 CTCLInterpreter::UnregisterCommand(const char* pCommand) const 
00767 {
00768 // Intended to support the deletion of
00769 // commands processed by C language functions
00770 // This member will remove a command if it exists or
00771 // throw an exception if it does not.
00772 //
00773 // Formal Parameters:
00774 //       const char*             pCommand
00775 //       const CTCLString&  rCommand
00776 //       const std::string&     rCommand:
00777 //             The command to delete.
00778 // NOTE:
00779 //    The command's deletion processor will
00780 //  be called by TCL in the event one was
00781 //  established.
00782 
00783   Tcl_DeleteCommand(m_pInterpreter, (char*)pCommand);
00784 
00785 }
00787 //
00788 //  Function:   
00789 //    std::string GetResultString (  )
00790 //  Operation Type:
00791 //     Selector
00792 //
00793 std::string 
00794 CTCLInterpreter::GetResultString() const 
00795 {
00796 // Returns a string containing the TCL result string
00797 // if no string has been set, an empty string is returned.
00798 
00799   return std::string(m_pInterpreter->result);
00800 
00801 }
